pages.text: Dvinosaurus is a freshwater amphibious temnospondyl that lived in the Late Permian period. It was found near the northern Dvina River, where it gets its name. It had a short head and a long body and tail and its diet was comprised mostly of fish. It is thought to have fed by ambushing its prey from the riverbeds.
